column2: Field Marshal Alfred von Schlieffen was Chief of the General Staff of the German Army from 1891 to 1906. In 1905 and 1906, Schlieffen devised an army deployment plan for a war-winning offensive against the French Third Republic, in case of a two front war with russia. Now that his scenario has become reality, we know exactly what to do and will not hesitate, to take action. Gott mit uns!
We have mobilized our armies and are ready to strike on the enemy!
